We also need to stand up to the NRA and the gun manufacturers to start changing the culture of guns in this country. And we must defeat the growing ideology of hate that motivates many of these horrific acts of domestic terrorism. 

I am going to be part of the change. Are you?

We need stronger gun safety laws, like the universal background check legislation still waiting for a vote in the Senate. We need more mental health programs and resources. We need to expand economic opportunity in communities suffering from daily violence.

Enough is enough is enough. Before the names of the people murdered in El Paso are even known, yet another mass shooting in Ohio. We must never get numb to these  tragedies. Our thoughts and prayers only matter if backed  up with action to prevent these tragedies.

We cannot continue to respond to this epidemic with shrugs of indifference. I proudly cast my vote for bipartisan universal background check legislation. The Senate must act. This is the least we can do to honor the memories of all those lost daily to gun violence.

I join with all Americans in solidarity and prayers for the victims of yet another mass shooting. Having just returned from two days in El Paso and meeting so many wonderful people, I know the community will be united and find the strength to help each other in this awful time.

I return w/ renewed advocacy for bipartisan immigration reform that both secures our border and reforms our broken and overwhelmed immigration system, and am committed to sending aid to the countries in the Golden Triangle to address the root causes of the migration crisis.

In particular, the policy requiring people legally seeking asylum to remain in Mexico for months while their claim is slowly processed means individuals and families, many with young children, are forced to live in uncertain, overcrowded, and dangerous conditions #DemsattheBorder

I just completed an eye-opening visit to El Paso and Ciudad Juarez. We face a humanitarian crisis at our southern border, and I saw firsthand how the cruel actions of the Trump Administration are worsening the situation and increasing suffering. #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/JQIlKCXdWv
